website_summaries.verdict: When you want to play fetch at night, these glow-in-the-dark dog toys work well.
pros: No batteries are used with the ball, as it charges naturally when placed under any type of bright light
Only needs about 5 minutes under the light to begin glowing
cons: Glow only lasts for 20 to 30 minutes
Chewing dogs may break off pieces

customer_reviews.title: Very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My 100 lb German shepherd has played with this ball for almost 2 months now and he can't destroy it. Most toys or balls last about 10 to 15 minutes. It is by far his favorite toy. He chews on it endlessly!
customer_reviews.author: K9Arlo

customer_reviews.title: So sad this didn’t work for me!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Glow but didn’t hold up More than literally 10 minutes!! I have an 80 pound staffordshire terrier and she is definitely a chewer so I made sure not to give her too much time with the ball on her own and after about 6 tosses the ball was already broken!! She loved it while it lasted! Also didn’t know there was a hole right in the center and it’s hollow! If I Knew I wouldn’t have purchased. Definitely not good for dogs with a big jaw!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doggie love!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best glow in the dark item I have ever purchased! Playing with my dog is so funny with this ball. I will watch the ball quickly sail out of the backlight's range and it will be a yellow/white orb approaching the ground. Sometimes it will bounce before Annie gets it, other times not. Either way, the glowing orb stops, changes directions and floats (in a trotting run) back into the light. 3 years with this set. Many times over the fence but even then, follow the glow. If your dog doesn't care that it is dark, just stares at that thrower, this is the ball for you! I'll try to add a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ranae

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in no time
customer_reviews.text: The dog loved it. I thought it would be great for fetch at night to be able to find it in the woods or weeds. Too bad it didn't even make it to the first night. Our dog grabbed it and took off, chewing it like she does any other ball. Less than half an hour later and it was torn to shreds and we had to track down every piece to make sure she didn't eat it. Admittedly, she is an aggressive chewer, but we had always had great luck with the non-tennis ball chuck-its. If they could make these like the ultra balls, then it would be great. Right now though? Not even close to worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable ball for our German Shepherds!
customer_reviews.text: This brand, Chuckit, has always been a favorite of our GS dogs. We have 5 year old male and female German Shepherds and they love fetching this ball and trust me they can really chomp on them. They seem to last forever, especially the more solid type but thought I'd try the glow in the dark version. It glows very brightly when placed in sunlight for just a few minutes. I'm sure a lamp would also work well or maybe a bright LED flashlight. We also buy Kong products. Durable and safe. Try getting the large size for larger breeds.
customer_reviews.author: Taterbug

customer_reviews.title: So much FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! Fetch after dark isn’t something we do a ton but it is so much fun to watch the glow in the dark ball come back! It’s great for during the day too. The whistle effect is great. The ball the Chuck It comes with lasted about ten minutes but these are fantastic. Charlie loves this ball and the blue whistler ball so much we have to put them away until the next time it’s time for fetch. Otherwise, he drives himself crazy bouncing it and rolling it around the house. We’ve had them several months and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Dogs favorite ball still in one piece!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one back in Sept 2019. It is now March 2020 and I'm back to order 2 more! First one is still in excellent condition and that is saying alot. We have a Huge King Shepherd that can tear through a case (approx 30) tennis balls in a single day (most I've given him in a day lol)... Tore through so many "indestructible" balls. Even the ones that can breaks your toes when it lands on em. This one is light weight, bouncy, and he will cry if it rolls under something... He simply adores it! Summer is coming and buying more to stock up! I'm sure it won't be the last!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: We purchased may Chuckit balls and for some reason my dogs love these over the other ones. They stopped playing with the other ones at home and will only play with these. The texture of these balls are smooth. I was a little worried about their durability as they didn't feel as sturdy as the other chuckit balls, but they seem to be holding up. so I guess they are okay. Giving 5 stars because my dogs love them so much. They glow In the dark so it was kind fun for the kids to play with the dogs with them in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: John Fang

customer_reviews.title: Your dog won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I love these balls. They last forever! The oldest one I have is at least 10 years old and it's still intact. My dogs love playing ball and these don't disappoint. They're very bouncy, don't come apart (even with gnarly dog teeth) and it's fun that they glow in the dark. They don't pose a danger like other balls that have a large hole in them (where a dog's tongue can get stuck). I have at least 8 of these in the yard and around the house. By far the best dog ball.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah213

customer_reviews.title: Glows and bounces well.  Just ordered wrong size
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. They glow very well. Once we charged them up with the light you could tell it was illuminating even before turning the light off. They aren't as thick as a kong toy but they did bounce well. I unfortunately selected the wrong size and they were too small for our boxer. I decided to return them and they allowed me to keep them and refunded the cost. We donated them to the local shelter for the pups there. I would definitely order again though in a larger size when it's time to replace her ball again.
customer_reviews.author: Quail

customer_reviews.title: Chuck it Obsessed Labrador !
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador Retrever is completely obsessed with the Chuckit glow ball. The plastic launcher at least doubles or triples your throwing distance and picks up the ball without “slime fingers” from your dogs mouth! The two holes in the ball cause a distinctive whistling sound when thrown with speed . 15-30 seconds under a bright flashlight and the ball glows bright for 10-15 minutes. The material is pretty tough and takes chewing much better than I thought it would. They float for water retrieval! Even our 20 lb Cavalier Spaniel loves the small glow ball. Their Great !
customer_reviews.author: theflipguy

customer_reviews.title: Doggie LOVES it!! 😍
customer_reviews.text: I can't really rate the durability and all yet since this is new but our doggie LOVES it. Much smaller than expected for large size. It does get very slippery, which is amusing watching dog chase it when it shoots out her mouth but can be annoying when trying to play fetch. Haven't used it at night yet but seems to glow bright. Has two holes in it, slightly worried she will damage it since so pliable but hoping it lasts. It's one of her favorite toys 🙂 Fast shipping, good price and buying experience
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Golden approved!
customer_reviews.text: We love this ball! I have a Golden who wants to play ball 24/7. I bought this so we could still play after dark. Sometimes we shine a flash light on it before playing and it really glows bright! My dog absolutely loves this ball and even with a bit of chewing, it’s stayed in one piece. Great price, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE these. They will actually FIGHT over them which is why I bought more! My little one loves chewing them and my golden loves to catch them. Even after days of chewing on the balls, there are no marks. They are VERY durable. Also, I love that they glow in the dark because I don't lose them in the yard! The holes on the side make them easy to throw. I also like that they bounce pretty easily. Overall these are a win for any dog that loves to play fetch or just likes to chew on balls.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I read a bunch of reviews about how this is indestructible. Its not. My 6 year old tore it apart in like 45 minutes. It works great at the park to throw with chuck it. It does not last long if your dog is laying there chewing on it. I bought more for the park but won't let them chew on it at home. The blacl large Kong is better for home yo chew on. My dogs have not tore that apart and its been days. Update: my dog figured out how to destroy it. Last 10 minutes. Dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rootsyliving

customer_reviews.title: Great for night time fetch
customer_reviews.text: With work, I was getting home at dusk or night time. I had been playing fetch with balls and Frisbee in the spot light, but my dog would sometimes loose them sometimes. This ball is nice and soft, but not soft enough to fall apart. It is actually hollow and makes a whistle sound when thrown. It glows fairly well, but remember you have to leave it out in the sun or it won't absorb enough light to glow that night. So far it has held up well and my dog loves it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spillers

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, Holds it's 'glow' for a surprisingly long time
customer_reviews.text: I got it on Amazon because it was about half the price of buying it locally. My dog is 80 pound lab mix and the large size is perfect. Although he does have some other 2.5" fetch balls that he loves as well so either size would be OK for a dog in that size range. We leave it sitting on the kitchen counter about 3 feet below hanging ceiling light fixtures. It holds it's 'charge/glow' outside in the dark for a good 15-20 minutes. The kids love watching their 'invisible' dog bring it back to the house at night. All you can see is the glowing ball in his mouth as he runs across the yard.
customer_reviews.author: S. WOLFF

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this product!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a ball that could be seen at night for my GSD puppy so I got this one as it had a lot of good reviews and a well know brand. However my 9 month old GSD puppy already chewed through some of it in a matter of a couple days and now I don’t want to have him play with it as I’m afraid he will swallow or eat the plastic. I’m bummed about this as I really liked the ball and that it lows in the dark but will have to buy a tougher ball for my dog. 😪
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: It glows BRIGHT! It is durable and exceeds my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest ball ever! I’ve only held it up to a light for probably a minute tops slowly turning it and it lights up bright! My dog loves playing ball in the dark so now we both can see it for him to retrieve it and it’s hilarious watching this glowing thing bouncing around as he runs back up the hill from the woods. You can’t see him but most def can see the ball in his mouth😂 Also it has passed the test of his jaws so I imagine it’ll be around for a long time to come! Soooo well worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mackenzie Lutz

customer_reviews.title: It works and it’s super durable
customer_reviews.text: It works, if you charge it. Another poster mentioned needing to charge it for 5 min under and LED light and he’s right. If you do that it works. It’s not super bright, but you can see it if your dog doesn’t. My only recommendation is to look at sizes. Our dog loves tennis ball size which I think it medium. We bought the large and it’s definitely larger than our chuck it and other tennis balls. Not a huge issue for our golden, but would’ve preferred the medium.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Braby

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, glows brightly, bounces great. Dog pleaser.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. If a dog is big and determined it can tear the rubber, but our Rottie loves it. He can bite hard and usually destroys pretty much anything hard he can get in is mouth, but seems to enjoy just chewing more leisurely on this ball. This is second purchase of this item. One bought maybe five years ago and used by many dogs at the park lost some of its glow and flexibility but is still in good enough condition to throw and bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Ancramdale

customer_reviews.title: Super durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog will destroy and consume tennis balls and the other chuck it balls without the hole in the middle. The hole makes it so that when he chews on it, it gives a little instead of popping and breaking which gives him a seam to start his destruction. Given enough time with it, he has still eaten one but I will continue buying these because they're also glow in the dark and they seem to fly better than a solid ball! When I get home late and he's ready to go, we can still play! It also makes a cool noise after you chuck it!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Plot Hound and Black lab. They both live to play fetch.. I am so glad this has a hole in it and hollow because since if feels like I am always playing fetch and throwing the ball it is easier on my shoulder. When I use the solid rubber chuck-it balls using the chuck it my shoulders tend to feel it more...Plus our dogs can locate this ball at night. This is the second one I have ordered the dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this ball
customer_reviews.text: He loves the ball so much he refuses to give it back to me. I try playing fetch but he just runs off with the ball to play with it himself. It seems very durable, he destroys toys called invincibles. He looks for the balls when we put them up high to get light and keep him from losing or destroying them. They work great in the dark, it's funny with our black dog running with a glowing ball in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright and durable
customer_reviews.text: Got a Boston Terrier and this guy is not easy on toys. This one holds up with his chewing and I was VERY surprised how long it stay lite up for. I am up in New England so not much sun in winter so I put it under a lamp for a couple of hours and it worked out great. Couple of times forgot it out in yard and still with limited light it still was pretty darn bright at night. So really impressed with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D.

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a very happy glow pup!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these he chomps on them all the time he loves to chase them we can play in the dark nobody better try and take his ball. when I throw them I have to have an extra ball because he's not giving up the one he just got until he sees another one ready to go lol. Is 110 lb German Shepherd and he is yet to tier one up and I've had some for over 6 months. I keep a supply so if we loose one we always have more.
customer_reviews.author: Mslonewolf

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the large ball. It is a rather flexible ball with a hole in the top and bottom. While my dog was running around playing with it, the ball suction itself to the roof of his mouth & his tongue simultaneously, blocking his air supply. Thank goodness I was home & was able to get it out. He was shaken up afterwards and very scared of the ball - we returned it after less than 30 minutes of play.
customer_reviews.author: Ad A

customer_reviews.title: It’s the Ghost Baaaallllll!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome and fun ball. We have one dog that is a total crack head and is literally always moving and always destroying balls. This one she is more ‘gentle’ with but it’s more durable than a tennis ball. It’s great fun at night to chuck this ball through our pitch black yard and it all of a sudden is floating back to us! We get lots of giggles and she gets fun! I also use it in the house sometimes, we turn off the lights and toss it for our puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Davis

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES these balls.
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these balls. She always has one in her mouth. When she eats ,she drops it in her food bowl and eats around it. These are one of the few balls that she can't destroy no matter how much she chews on them. They are easy to find at night time when she hides them in the yard. You can see them in the middle of the night any where in the house.
customer_reviews.author: JTB 19702

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: Our dog, Bernie, loves this ball and so do we. It's visible from way across the field and makes it possible to have a chase in the cool of the evening. The colors are brilliant and and it cycles through different colors and also works well with the chuck-it thrower. Reach for the ball at home and Bernie gets all happy because he loves it. At first when we tried it out at home, the battery fell out, we had to reinsert it and tighten up the closure and it's been fine since.
customer_reviews.author: shenza

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this ball!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is great! It's not a perfect fit inside the chuck-it attachment, but it works with it. It seems the ball is just slightly too small, but it still picks up and can be thrown (large chick it). It glows very well and the glow lasts a lot longer than any other glow ball I've purchased. It's definitely worth the money if your dog likes to play fetch at all hours! It's also pretty tough. My dog chews the orange chuck it balls to pieces in minutes if she's left alone with it, but this one she's not able to chew apart for some reason!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT! Best balls for strong jaws, too! Hours of gnawing and fetching!
customer_reviews.text: These r the best! So fun at night time- quick holding up to light and it’ll glow! My Rottweiler can’t destroy them either- THAT is always an issue when buying toys. Tennis balls are shredded in less than a minute. These balls are soft enough to squeeze and chew and gnaw but won’t ever pop/break/rip/tear... I bought two sizes and we use both! He loves them equally and so do we... fun to throw with the holes too- they have the slightest whistle which is also fun for him listen for and track! The can fly!
customer_reviews.author: kaytown12

customer_reviews.title: Quality balls, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I laughed too hard at an answer to a question I read back in September 2019. The answer did not disappoint. This is my dog's favorite toy. He *LOVES* to play fetch, and would do it till he dropped if I let him. I'm disabled, and couldn't throw a ball nearly as far as he'd like, but between Chuck-It, and their quality balls, my dog is a happy boy.
customer_reviews.author: Flecksable Flyer

customer_reviews.title: but it didn't take her long to destroy them (she's not good about keeping her favorite toys intact
customer_reviews.text: Fits in a medium chuck-it. My 60lb pittie loves them, but it didn't take her long to destroy them (she's not good about keeping her favorite toys intact. If it can be destroyed, it WILL be destroyed, and if it can't...she's not interested). Sometimes these balls make a whistling nose when thrown, which really attracts her attention. The glow is awesome--only takes a few seconds with a flashlight or phone light to charge these, and they stay bright for quite a while. Perfect for winter-time fetching! I'll probably have to find somewhere to buy these things in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glow is decent - rubber is softer than expected
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how long this will last. The rubber is softer than expected. The glow is decent even after hours of darkness I can still see it enough not to step on it. I didn't like the two holes in it at first but when you use with a launcher it makes the ball whistle which is kind of cool. Not super loud or annoying but just enough to peak interest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them,  great price
customer_reviews.text: My dog has always loved glow balls, and this brand is no different. These were slightly cheaper than other brands but work just the same. They glow brightly which is helpful when the dog loses the ball. My only complaint is that they bounce to well and sometimes bounce right over my fence. I have to go on a hunt every fall to see if I can recover any lost balls. Its best to have a few lol.
customer_reviews.author: Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Take a flashlight with you to recharge
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. I have three pits who are toy aggressive so sadly we can’t go to dogs parks at normal hours. We go in the dead of night (probably not legal but hey) and they absolutely love these. They barely fit in a regular size Chuck It but if you throw them hard enough they whistle! All the dogs tear after them even if they’ve still got their own glowing ball in their mouth already. They haven’t worn out on me yet but if they do I’ll definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Chuckit is worth the Bucks(it)
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd has finally met her match and friend. This is actually the first ball we have come across that upholds her bite and chewing as she gallops through the yard (showing off for the neighbors cats). The glow is a nice added bonus as well. We have tried tennis balls, lacrosse balls and order a ball that was suppose to with stand dogs play which lasted aox three tosses at best. Chuckit is needed by your dog!
customer_reviews.author: GoodtoGo

customer_reviews.title: DOGS BEST FRIEND
customer_reviews.text: This ball is incredible. Our golden retriever plays with it all day. It’s completely indestructible and fits in his mouth perfectly. He plays with it all day on the hill by himself. It is his best friend, which I’m just fine with. The only downside is that it barely floats so it can be hard to see in the water if you dog loses track of it.
customer_reviews.author: Scotcher

customer_reviews.title: It really does glow! and my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: The ball has a good glow, soft enough for my dog to grab it (she's 65lbs) and it has a good bounce. I've only had it for two weeks so I can't attest to its longevity. Also my dog isn't a chewer, so I can't say how it would hold up to another dog's use. She likes to play a little tug with items she fetches and the ball has held up to that.
customer_reviews.author: Noura Randle

customer_reviews.title: Great for our golden retreivers
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for balls that did not have a squeaker that the dogs could get out of them, were sturdy, and great size for our golden retrievers. These balls are IT!! Love them. Makes for fun evenings of "retrieving". We recommend for those that would like a ball that can't be ruined easily.
customer_reviews.author: d man

customer_reviews.title: Great for night time fetch!
customer_reviews.text: Murphy- raisin loves his glow ball! My son thought it was so cool I had to buy two so that the dog could actually have a turn playing with it. We take my dog to my parents who have over an acre and when he gets lazy he stops bringing the ball back and then we have to hunt it down in the grass at night. This thing is great! Glow stays a good 15-20 min. It doesn’t stay super bright but enough where you can always find it. Tip: it charges super fast when you use a black light flashlight and stays super bright! Maybe it’s an Arizona thing that we all have blacklight flashlights for the scorpions 😂
customer_reviews.author: Klouie

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: With winter darkness, I needed something to maintain my cattle dog's fetch game. These glow in the dark balls would be merely "very good" if these reviews hadn't clued me in to the power of a cheap UV flashlight. Seriously, I can't overstate how much 10 seconds of UV light SUPERCHARGERS these things. Super bright for 3-4 long throws... then still at normal brightness for a while (though I just give them a 10 second recharge). Between the glowing and the whistling, our guy can track these as well as day time.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: the can last forever if you dont run over them with a mower.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set, my dog has played fetch with them for a few years now, and the only reason I am buying another set is that I hit one with my mower blade. It still holds its form, even with the split in it. otherwise my English Bulldog has not damaged these at all. get a black light flashlight and you can play fetch at night with them.
customer_reviews.author: EdTheRed

customer_reviews.title: This ball is the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Like many dog owners, I have purchased countless toys and balls, that have been destroyed by my dog. Tennis balls, or the typical tennis-like balls are no match for my determined chewer. But this ball has lasted for 6 months, despite my dog's best efforts to chew it. He loves this ball so much that I had to buy it again just to have extras in the car for trips to the dog park. Hands down the best purchase I've ever made for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: A Glowing Review
customer_reviews.text: Daylight saving time is over, so it gets dark before I can get out of work to play fetch with my dog, but these glow so brightly we can play at night. They are large enough that he cannot cram two into his mouth, like he does with tennis balls, making it easier to do relay fetching. He can also see them when they roll off of the porch, under the flower bushes, reducing damage to the landscaping.
customer_reviews.author: Q kat

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: Geena's favorite thing in the world is her ball. She LOVES how bouncy this is, and the fact is glows at night is a plus for night play sessions. The whistle effect is also really nice, my niece finds it really hilarious that it does this. Very durable, Geena has yet to chew one apart but she isn't really a power chewer. She loves how squishy this ball is and I think she enjoys the weird noises it makes when she does squish it. Pretty much the only ball I go for at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog's favorite ball. It is hollow and has a hole in either end (I suppose to put treats in). It sometimes whistles when you throw it. The glow doesn't take long to charge (just hold it to an interior light for about a minute). I can play catch with my dog after the sun sets, which is perfect as the days get shorter. Also, if he decides not to bring it back, I can find it quickly so that I don't loose it in the grass and run over it with the lawnmower, as I have done with countless tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: DHam

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: These glow in the dark balls are super. They are very sturdy as my dog chews on them a lot with no damage. They bounce well and sort of whistle when thrown. MUCH, much better than tennis balls. I purchased 3 sets of two each so we can have some at our summer residence and have a set for for a gift. Highly recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF OBSESSION FORMING HABITS - THIS BALL IS ADDICTIVE
customer_reviews.text: Like crack for dogs! Since dogs see yellow and blue spectrum as their predominant colors this glowing green ball is the best of all worlds!! It makes noise when thrown, it glows for a long time if properly engergized and it’s made of the material dogs love to gnaw on, but can’t quite break through easily! One of my dogs won’t even bring it back to me and the other is reluctant, but eventually she does. This is a highly coveted item in my household. But one (or four like me) and you’ll see...truly amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: seanNsf

customer_reviews.title: He has had them over a month and it is his favorite toy. He is a lab and just constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes crazy for these. He has had them over a month and it is his favorite toy. He is a lab and just constantly plays on his own with these. Holding them in his mouth, dropping it and then chasing them. He also seems to love squishing them in his mouth. they do glow nicely which I think is cool. I will be buying more in the future! My dog is a heavy chewer but I don't see these breaking. The balls get slippery so even if he wanted to chew them I think they would roll away easily. BUY them! your dog will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these. I have a large breed who loves to chew. These are the only toys he has ever owned that he hasn’t been able to destroy even a little bit! They are very easy to clean, making them a much better alternative than tennis balls. I also love that they glow in the dark, so he can always find them.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Katastrophe

customer_reviews.title: My dog is obsessed with these
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is about these glow in the dark balls but my dog is OBSESSED with them. The only thing is, we sometimes lose them around the house (and find them months later underneath some piece of furniture), so I was happy to find this two-pack on sale. My dog tears through plush toys and ropes so fast, but this is long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever, they won't play
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected, my fault. I thought it would be solid. Doesn't matter, none of my dogs like it. I thought it would be nice for our doberman. She killed her giant tennis ball so I wanted something stronger. But she won't play with it. Maybe a texture thing? I dunno. Seems like a fine ball tho.
customer_reviews.author: Chad AddingtonTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Fantistic Dog Ball
customer_reviews.text: I have two very aggressive chewers, and this is the second time I have purchased this ball for them. The first one got lost somehow. It has fantastic durability, it makes a funny sound that the dogs love when they chew it in the right orientation, and you can throw it for your pets in the dark. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Xebra

customer_reviews.title: Great Item! Golden Loves it
customer_reviews.text: We got these glow in the dark balls after seeing a man at a dog park at twilight. Our 4 year old golden retriever LOVES them!!! She sees them much better when the light is low and we can carry our fun of throwing and retrieving the ball late into the night. Visited some friends and their frenchies loved the balls as well so we left them one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller (Slightly) than a tennis ball (Medium) and dogs do not like them
customer_reviews.text: These are Medium, like a tennis ball, but do not have the same 'grip' within the Chuck It and slip or drop out too easily. Also, most importantly, our dogs do not return these as they do tennis balls. Other than texture, taste and smell (to them), I'm not sure why. But, that probably answers it, right?
customer_reviews.author: autotkgrad

customer_reviews.title: BEST dog ball ever!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, got a dog and lots of balls/toys. This is hands down the best! It glows bright, throws far, bounces high, makes a cool noise as it’s flying, is chewable and since it is hollow and has two holes our dog can breath easily while running with this ball in his mouth. It’s awesome playing with him at night!
customer_reviews.author: Jaret Heil

customer_reviews.title: glows and wiffles to a degree, what more do you want
customer_reviews.text: The fetcher hasn't trashed these yet, so A+ on the durability. Have not had long enough to gauge longevity, but they appear environmentally inert so I'm bullish on their lasting power. I kicked one off the deck today, and it bounces and was readily fetched just like it did when it bounced into our fetcher's field of view. That is all we ask of a ball like this.
customer_reviews.author: Lazlo Diozsak

customer_reviews.title: Dog has not destroyed it yet
customer_reviews.text: We have great difficulty finding toys/chews for our 1 year old dog (23 lbs) He generally chews things into oblivion in no time, but he actually plays with this toy and tries to chew on it. Maybe its the size, but so far, lots of play time with this. He actually "throws" it and then chases it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1 year old Belgian Malinois and she absolutely loves this toy. She's never without it. I had to order 2 more because she lost the first one. It really helps that it's hollow in the middle so she can't chew it up. This will forever be her toy and i'm sure i will be ordering more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as a nightlight....
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because we keep loosing balls in the yard/bushes. But she is not crazy about it like the other ChuckIt Orange and blue rubbery balls. Actually the ball is smooth. My dog seems to like something with more tooth. We have been using it as a night-light. She is afraid of the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I play at night ,use light to get it ready for night 20mins of fun. but most of all its not been chewed up and the 2 holes I put snacks in it and my dog loves to roll it around getting he snacks. Also I have a pit Stafford service dog she loves this new toy, and it cleans easy and stay clean most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great for night OR day!
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love it during the night OR day! Doesn't need to get much sun to follow in the dark. My phone just doesn't do justice with night photography so I'm adding pics from the day. I've got a Belgian malinois and a puppy German Shepherd. This ball is still in the same condition as when we got it and that's saying alot.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: excellent glow
customer_reviews.text: I charge this before leaving my house for a dog walk, and the ball stays aglow for 15 minutes of fetch. About perfect. Careful though: I melted one of these by leaving it too close to the light bulb for several minutes (2 inches away from a 100W incadescent). Keep yours a bit further from the bulb or they will deform.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Betti

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for dogger and  human friends!
customer_reviews.text: These Chuck-it balls are the best - great quality and durability AND they glow great inside or out. Not sure who gets the greatest enjoyment out of these at this point. 😎 Even in daylight - if they roll under a bush or end up in a drain you can easily see them for retrieval. Great fun.
customer_reviews.author: randy k

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it glows, BRIGHTLY...but...
customer_reviews.text: The brightness drops off very quickly. After only a minute or three, it's back to being a white-ish ball. Now you could keep a flashlight in your pocket and recharge it. But if you were thinking it would be great for 10 minutes of play, know it will be great for 2-4 throws. Then a little less great. Then a lot less great. Then just a white ball. Also, the large ball I got is bigger than a tennis ball. Yes, they told me that it wouldn't fit in the Classic Chuck-it, but I didn't read that part. I mention it, so that you don't make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Zelenka

customer_reviews.title: Great for energetic dogs and limited day light hours
customer_reviews.text: Had one for around 10 days, bought the two pack afterwards. This is a lifesaver. It gets so dark so early this time of year, I can still play fetch with my pup and wear her out after 430/5pm. It glows well, and she doesn't ever seem to lose this ball like she does ordinary tennis balls during the daylight hours. Holds up to her chomping on it, but I try to take it away once we get inside since these are a little more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for play to n the dark!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 13 Month old labradoodle and he is full of energy. Adopted him in late fall so it was difficult to find toys that would work well in a dark back yard. This toys is awesome. Glows quickly when exposed to light and keeps its glow. Makes a fun sound when thrown because there are holes in the ball. Really helps when you have two ball players at home. Had about 2 weeks and it’s one of his favorite toys!
customer_reviews.author: Busy working mom

customer_reviews.title: Great glow, but don't store it in the sun
customer_reviews.text: Great glow, could light up by the park walkway lights, and chucks really well. However, lost its shape in the Arizona sun - we left it in the backyard and it's been half-flat ever since. He still chases it, it just won't roll anymore. Keep it inside when you're not using it and you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W. Mccauley

customer_reviews.title: Best retrieving balls I've found
customer_reviews.text: HEADS UP! TENNIS BALLS BLUNTED MY YOUNG STANDARD POODLE'S TEETH in just a year of daily retrieving! =( I switched to more expensive balls, and these are my favorite. They glow and whistle slightly, which helps him track them when it's getting dark. They've also got a good bounce. We recently lost his first one down a rabbit hole, and it was not damaged at all after four months of daily catching, fetching, and chewing. I've just bought two more. I don't know what makes them glow and can only trust that it is truly non-toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Fran

customer_reviews.title: Labrador didn’t destroy it.
customer_reviews.text: Our favorite ball to play with our Labrador. Tennis balls do not last near as long as this ball. The glowing is nice for playing at night when the dog doesn’t watch and runs in the wrong direction. Throw it hard and it whistles too. Like it so much we bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Dale

customer_reviews.title: Incredible toy, my dog loves his
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the balls that my furry k9 friend has this is his favorite. I had to order a few of these just to make sure he always has access to one. He runs around the house, as well as outside. Happy with this call in his mouth. And the ability to toss it around for him at night is a huge plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great for night fetch
customer_reviews.text: Glow in the dark ball is awesome for backyard evening and night fetch with the dogs! Unfortunately my dogs are large and love to chew...so they were able to shred them at the first moment they were left with them. I would highly recommend for small or medium dogs...or dogs that dont like to chew up balls. It was definitely fun while they lasted!!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: great phosphorescence!
customer_reviews.text: It glows in the dark really well. I really wish it would float because our dog likes to take the ball into our pond to cool off. I can't rate its longevity yet because we haven't gotten to play with it that much, but it seems like it should be pretty sturdy,
customer_reviews.author: Debdoll

customer_reviews.title: It glows!
customer_reviews.text: Just like any other Chuck It ball. Same durability and quality you'd expect. Glows in the dark for fetch at night. Whistles when thrown to help pup hear as well as see. Does not "charge" well with natural light but place under lamp and charges bright fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tsmith

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves playing ball all day long. At night time when we are trying to wear her down before bed this ball has been a blessing! We stay out for about 30 minutes and the ball doesn't lose it's glow. If it starts to fad I just pop the flashlight against it for maybe 15-30 seconds and it lights right back up.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaC

customer_reviews.title: Great & easy to see at night!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I have lost countless tennis balls, light up balls, and chuck it bright colored balls during the winter time since it gets dark at 4:30 p.m. All of the light up balls stopped working because my pup has a tendency to chew the ball as he brings it back, but these are durable and glow super bright so they are easy to find. will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's Favorite Ball
customer_reviews.text: My pup is OBSESSED with balls, but these ones are her absolute favorite. They make a great whistling sound when thrown and she loves that she can bite down on them (they're hollow) and I love how durable they are! She hasn't destroyed a single one to date.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Dog's favorite ball!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is obsessed with this ball. It has a whole that goes straight through, which gives it a nice give for him to happily chew on. It also has a good bounce and is a favorite to chase. Plus the glow-in-the dark makes it easy to find when in rolls under furniture! I bought another one for our neighbor's dog because it's been such a hit with our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Super Ball!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ball. It charges well with any light. It actually gets a bit brighter than I expected. I got it because I lost a different dog toy in the park, but I know I'm not going to lose this one. It even glows nicely just exposing it to a cell phone light.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Very very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 and a half pitbull and she destroys everything. A friend of mine advised to get this ball because it lasted awhile well she wasn’t wrong!! Couldn’t be more happy with this purchase. Looking to buy more in the future!! The glow works very well too!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C.

customer_reviews.title: Best ball bar none
customer_reviews.text: Best ball bar none!!!! Have a giant Lab and medium Catahula/Beagle and they will chase these balls till the cows come home!!! Live on a ranch in the high desert so hit the balls with a tennis racket (my arm ain't whut it used to be) in the cool of early morning and after dark!!! Store them out of reach (DO NOT LEAVE THEM WITH DOGS UN SUPERVISED WHEN NOT CHASING THEM BECAUSE THEY WILL HAND THEM BACK TO YOU IN PIECES) in bright sun or fluorescent light and they really GLOW!!! The whistling effect gets the dogs attention!!!! Have experimented with battery powered balls and these are superior and more cost effective!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bisbee Blue

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 32 minutes !
customer_reviews.text: Never saw it glow , literally lasted 32 minutes before it cracked at the circular hole on one of the ends. I have a 60 lb mix. This was a complete waste of money, the planet Orbee balls at least last for a month.
customer_reviews.author: powerby50

customer_reviews.title: Does Glow and Float
customer_reviews.text: The ball floats but can be somewhat difficult for the dog to pick up/see in the water due to the color. I would not recommend this for hard chewers as mine started to break after one day. It is still in tact, but would rather see it be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: KPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this ball. It's just the right size that she can grab it in her mouth. I haven't used it for treat dispensing but think it would work great for that as well. I am just tired of always having to get it from under my couch!
customer_reviews.author: jenna4m

customer_reviews.title: Fun at nigh
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a ballaholic. Working late, it's hard to play ball outside. This makes it easy and fun for the both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: My Dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: my dog loves it. i have a dalmatian that is deaf. so she dont hear the bouncing of the ball if it passes her line of sight. had some similar where they lit up which helped but goes out after a few second. these are amazing. she can find it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Nirvan Bhagwandeen

customer_reviews.title: Fun for nighttime play
customer_reviews.text: These balls are great for furbabies that just don't want to stop playing just because the sun went down. I leave them under a lamp during the day and they are ready to go at night. My pitbull/bulldog loves to chew on them while taking a break and she Doesn't destroy them! (Most balls last about 5-10 minutes) I highly recommend these for fun nighttime play!
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Shea Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Durable and relatively bright
customer_reviews.text: Since days are getting shorter I've been using these glow balls for morning and evening time with the dog. I bring up flashlight with of course for myself but also to recharge these and they whistle when you throw them so it's easy for the dog to pick them up while they're midair and my dog likes to try to play keep-away with me and chew on it as he runs around but he's so far has not hurt them. They will get a little slimy I just roll it around in the grass and then wash it when I get home
customer_reviews.author: Don't Bother Me

customer_reviews.title: Poor toy didn’t stand a chance against my toy killer
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a bit longer than most, but that was with taking it away when not playing outside. Was hopeful for this one.. but today was ripped apart into tiny pieces. Loved the glow feature though. Hopeful one without a treat opening will come out in future.
customer_reviews.author: V.konopacki

customer_reviews.title: Fun to have but not to last
customer_reviews.text: Great for me because my dog loves to play ball 24/7 so that means sometimes at night but the material is very thin. I bought a 2 pack and my GSD went through the first one within a month. So I only use it for dark night play time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and holds the Glow!
customer_reviews.text: Been using with our Plott hound for seceral weeks. He loves it. Allows us to fetch in the dark. He's use to chomping on a squeecky tennis ball when he runs and does the same with these. They're holding up wonderfully. Works great with the Chuck-it stick.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B. Knobloch

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Luv Em!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (German shepherds) always love these balls. They like to "chonk" on them for hours. It's amazing how durable they are. They bounce well and this enables me to throw them off the walls inside the house (when my wife isn't home!). I also love the fact that they glow in the dark. This is great for playing with the dogs at night. It's also helpful to see them in the middle of the night.....I don't trip on them when I have to get up and go pee!
customer_reviews.author: Barz

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and easily visible at night
customer_reviews.text: It keeps us in the game, even at night. It's not fragile, but I doubt it's indestructible. I have let my dog chew on it for about 20 minutes a couple times and he did not shred it. When it eventually does fall apart I will buy another, because night time ball is just fun.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Smith

customer_reviews.title: Dakoda loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Great! They do indeed glow, and they are the perfect size for the Chuck it launcher (standard tennis ball size). The only downfall for me is that they are the type of rubber that hair sticks too... Otherwise they are perfect, and my German shepherd / lab mix (along with a few other breeds, she was a rescue ❤️) absolutely loves them! Chuck it's are her absolute favorite toys, and about the only thing decently priced she can't destroy!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Glows really bright but that's about it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an advid chewer and toys normally don't last long. This one was no exception. 3 different toys arrived today and he absolutely loved this one. Unfortunately within 20 minutes I found myself picking up pieces off the floor. It does glow pretty brightly but that's about it. There is a hole right down the middle which makes this ball very squishy; but the hole is exactly where he was able to start tearing it apart from.
customer_reviews.author: duane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great glow in the dark ball. My American Bull Dog would play all night in the back yard if we would let him. I have purchased at least 7 of these in the past 2 years. I have to buy them in sets; 1 for inside and 1 for out side. They hold up well to his chewing and tug of war. He has a strong jaw and we use the holes to try and pull it out of his mouth, hence tug of war!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might turn out like so many other 'indestructible' toys I got for my dog, an incessant chewer. Happily, I was wrong, the favorable reviewers were right. She plays with it every day, hasn't made a dent.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: Lasts about 30 min. Usually take out with a flashlight. Flash the light on it a few seconds before throwing. After three times of this, ball glows for a good 10 min. So 15 secs to last 10 min is pretty good to me. Left under bright light for a bit then I can get 30 min or so. Makes it easy to see in dark and see where dog is by the floating ball.
customer_reviews.author: Big Pete

product_meta.title: Chuckit! Max Glow Ball
product_meta.description: Size:Medium 2-Pack| Color:WhiteWith Chuckit! Max glow ball, pets and pet parents can enjoy exciting, high-visibility fetch, even after dark. Ideal for pets who are active at night or pet parents who get home late, the Chuckit! glow ball requires charging for as little as 5 minutes for 20 minutes of glowing playtime. For extended play on-the-go, The max glow ball recharges in seconds under a bright flashlight. The glow-in-the-dark Chuckit! ball features a photo-luminescent material that's both eye-catching and safe for pets. The surface texture allows pets to get a firm grip while catching and N and is resistant to dirt and slobber for easy cleaning. Available in four sizes ranging from Small to Extra-Large, dogs of all sizes can enjoy fetch with the Chuckit! light up dog toy. Two-packs are available in select sizes for pet parents to keep an extra glow in the dark dog ball on hand. The Chuckit! max glow ball is compatible with a variety of Chuckit! launchers, enhancing fetch with slobber-free pickup and long-distance throws.
feature_bullets: GLOW IN THE DARK BALL: Engage in play with your dogs & puppies after the sun sets with this glow in the dark ball for dogs. Hold under sunlight or flashlight for as little as 5 minutes for 20 minutes of play.
COMPATIBLE WITH BALL LAUNCHER: Rubber light up dog ball is compatible with tennis ball launchers for long range fetch.

PET TOYS: Get ready for bonding & fun with your dogs & cats! Check out a variety of our pet toy products such as frisbees, perches & mirrors for birds, prey wand toys for cats, plush toys, light-up interactive toys & more.

CHUCKIT! FETCH TOYS: Chuckit! creates toys that enrich the human-animal bond & bright colors help dogs & puppies stay engaged. Checkout Chuckit! for ball launchers, bouncy balls, frisbees, indoor dog toys, glow toys & more!

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
